channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Twinbrook: Man suffers stab wounds to head in Belfast attack
item.description: One man is arrested over the attack which happened in the Twinbrook estate in west Belfast.

item.title: Brexit: Lord Frost warns of 'cold mistrust' if NI Protocol swept away
item.description: The UK's Brexit minister however repeats calls for the EU to accept "substantial change".

item.title: Covid-19: NI records seven coronavirus-linked deaths, 1,812 cases
item.description: The total number of deaths linked to coronavirus in NI since the start of the pandemic is 2,401.

item.title: Covid-19: Testing term ahead as pupils returned to school
item.description: Concerns are raised about self-isolation advice and how the school return may affect case numbers.

item.title: World Cup qualifying: Late Duffy header saves Republic of Ireland from Azerbaijan defeat
item.description: Shane Duffy spares the Republic of Ireland's blushes with a late header to earn a World Cup qualifying draw with Azerbaijan in Dublin.

item.title: Paralympic Games: 'You have to be honest with yourself' says McKillop on future plans
item.description: Ireland's Michael McKillop says he is unsure if he will retire from athletics but confirmed this will be his last Paralympic Games after 'devastating' loss.

item.title: Katie Taylor: Irishwoman beats Jennifer Han to remain undisputed lightweight champion
item.description: Ireland's Katie Taylor remains undisputed world lightweight champion but is made to work by USA's Jennifer Han before winning on points.

item.title: 'I turned my barn into my own private pub'
item.description: A man coverts his disused farm shed into his very own Irish "pub" as a lockdown project.

item.title: Estonia v Northern Ireland: NI manager Baraclough set to ring changes for Tallinn friendly
item.description: Northern Ireland manager Ian Baraclough will make full use of his squad for Sunday's friendly against Estonia in Tallinn.

item.title: 'I found out I had five siblings when I was 73'
item.description: One woman's quest to find out more about her grandmother led to five big discoveries for her father.

item.title: Toome: Arrest after millions of suspected counterfeit cigarettes seized
item.description: HMRC says the discovery near Toome, County Antrim, represents a £3m loss in duty and taxes.

item.title: Essex lorry deaths: Man extradited from Italy to UK
item.description: Dragos-Stefan Dalmian is charged in connection with the deaths of 39 migrants in a trailer.

item.title: Covid-19: NI schools to get £5.5m for tracing pressures
item.description: Michelle McIlveen says schools will get £5.5m to tackle self-isolation and contact-tracing issues.

item.title: Scientists not backing Covid jabs for 12 to 15-year-olds
item.description: But 200,000 extra children with underlying conditions will now be eligible for two doses.

item.title: Covid-19: Nisra records highest weekly death toll since February
item.description: Covid-19 is mentioned on the death certificates of 53 people in the week leading up to 27 August.

item.title: Deputy First Minister Michelle O'Neill tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: A meeting of the Stormont Executive on Wednesday to discuss restrictions has been postponed until next week.

item.title: Covid-19: Economy minister calls for plans to end restrictions
item.description: Economy Minister Gordon Lyons says the NI Executive needs to "start moving on these issues".

item.title: NI hospitals: 400 emergency patients wait over 12 hours for bed
item.description: A senior doctor says many of those waiting for beds are "our most vulnerable patients".

item.title: Northern Ireland weather: Third-warmest summer since records began
item.description: The average temperature was 15.06C, setting this summer behind 2006 and 1995 on the all-time list.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Brexit: Couple divided by Irish border over immigration rules
item.description: Corrinne and Brett Giles live on either side of the Irish border due to post-Brexit immigration rules.

item.title: Storm names: Barra, Méabh, and Pól among names set for 2021-22
item.description: The storm names for the coming year are compiled by the British, Irish and Dutch weather services.

item.title: Troubles pensions scheme opens for applications
item.description: It offers payments to people injured during the Troubles but is more than a year behind schedule.

item.title: Pat Hume: Political leaders pay tribute to widow of John Hume
item.description: Political leaders have paid tribute to the widow of SDLP leader and Nobel prize winner John Hume.

item.title: Kesh River: Hundreds of fish killed in County Fermanagh
item.description: Anglers say it is the worst fish kill for decades in the Fermanagh area.

item.title: Northern Ireland Weather: NI experiences one of its warmest summers
item.description: The average temperature of summer 2021 was 1.17C above Northern Ireland's average, peaking at 31.3C in July.

item.title: South Armagh: Naomi Long asks, 'What inroads have unionists made?'
item.description: Naomi Long says parties should "move back" from calls for Simon Byrne to resign over a policing review.

item.title: Pat Hume: Tributes paid to 'extraordinarily strong' widow of John Hume
item.description: Ex-Irish President Mary McAleese describes Mrs Hume as the "perfect partner" to her husband John.

item.title: Pat Hume 'would welcome prince and pauper alike'
item.description: A teacher and community figure with her door always open - there was more to Pat Hume than politics.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Jason Smyth says tough Games build-up made him wonder if career was over
item.description: Jason Smyth says his latest Paralympic gold "has probably meant the most" after a difficult build-up to the Tokyo Games because of injury.

item.title: Afghanistan: Londonderry-based man says sister abducted in Kabul
item.description: Muhammad Edrees Kharotai wanted to get his family out of Afghanistan and bring them to Northern Ireland.

item.title: Irish Leaving Certificate grades up 2.4% on 2020
item.description: The increase is on top of a significant jump in results the year before.

item.title: Brexit: Longer grace periods not a solution says Varadkar
item.description: The Irish deputy PM said grace period extensions for Irish Sea border checks "just puts things off".

item.title: Irish economy bounces back as Covid-19 restrictions ease
item.description: Figures from the Central Statistics Office show the Republic of Ireland's GDP increased by 6.3%.

item.title: Stephen Kenny: Republic boss questions officials after his 'heroic' side suffer late Portugal agony
item.description: Stephen Kenny questions the officials' performance after his Republic of Ireland side come close to securing a shock win over Portugal.

item.title: Irish cabinet agrees to ease most Covid-19 rules
item.description: Ministers met on Tuesday to agree on a plan to ease most Covid-19 restrictions by 22 October.
